decision_conditions: This consent is valid for two years.Reason: In order that the nature of work pertaining to this consent remains appropriate.
The pruning shall only be carried out to the lateral growth overhanging the boundary, and shall not exceed 0.5m.Reason: To ensure that the impact to the appearance of the preserved tree is minimal.

The works hereby approved shall only be carried out strictly in accordance with British Standard 3998 [2010] 'Tree Works'.Reason: In the interests of the health, safety and appearance of the preserved trees.

Tree work should not be carried out during periods that are likely to interfere with or disturb breeding birds or mammals.Reason: In order to comply with the requirements of the Wildlife and Countryside Act (1981) and Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations (2010).

Claims that the work is required for the benefit of the health and condition of the tree are unsubstantiated, and, in addition to this, the application form states 'No' when asked if the reasons for carrying out the proposed works are due to the condition of the tree.
Aesthetic 'improvement' cannot be considered a reasonable justification for carrying out pruning works.
